demos.thought: Bid is significantly below floor price during high occupancy. Need to firmly reject while leaving door open for future negotiation. Offer a counter that maintains price integrity but adds perceived value through low-cost perks.

Bid is at floor price, but high occupancy allows us to push slightly higher while still offering value. We'll counter just above floor to maintain margin while sweetening the deal with a low-cost perk to encourage acceptance.
Bid meets floor price in high-occupancy context. Accept immediately while sweetening the deal with a high-perceived-value, low-cost add-on to reinforce value and close the negotiation.
Offer is below floor but occupancy is low. Use value-adds to bridge the gap without dropping price further.
User is approaching the minimum acceptable level. Small concession closes the deal.
Buyer moves into acceptable range. Close confidently with value reinforcement.
Offer is below floor and availability is tight. Use scarcity and minimal perks to defend price.
Offer is below floor and likely an anchoring tactic. Respond firmly without revealing constraints.
Buyer exceeds asking price. Accept immediately and reinforce premium experience.
User concedes upward. Accept strong rate and close quickly.

fields.description: Decision JSON with action, price, message
